alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Hunterdon; Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 12:46PM EDT until March 28 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Central Mercer County in central New Jersey... North central Burlington County in southern New Jersey... Eastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1245 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located near Richboro, or 14 miles west of Trenton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 6 and 7A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 346 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 39 and 40. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 51 and 76. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Ewing, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Doylestown, Hatboro, Bordentown, Pennington, New Hope, Yardley, Newtown, Tullytown, Langhorne, Ivyland, Washington Crossing, Feasterville-Trevose, Florence-Roebling, Feasterville and Woodside. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
